storyInfo: Two survivors are found in the ruins. Brigid entrusts them to Nemos's rescue team, but is shocked when she returns later to find that one of them has been left behind.

attributes.content: (sniffs)
attributes.name: Burdenbeast

attributes.content: (moves forward)
attributes.name: Burdenbeast

attributes.content: (pats ground with hoof)
attributes.name: Burdenbeast

attributes.content: Moo!
attributes.name: Burdenbeast

attributes.content: What is it? You find something?
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Moo!
attributes.name: Burdenbeast

attributes.content: Caught someone's scent? Which way? Take me there.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: We notified everyone in advance, and got the surrounding areas evacuated in time. The homes I saw on the way were mostly cleared out too, so if someone was left behind, we got a problem.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Moo!
attributes.name: Burdenbeast

attributes.content: This the spot? But there's nothing here.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: (nudges rubble with snout)
attributes.name: Burdenbeast

attributes.content: Hey! Don't touch anything! Even if I can't see 'em, what if someone's down there?
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Move aside, big one. I need to get past you.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Hello? Can you hear me?
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: I'm Brigid the nomad. If you can hear me and still move, then try to tap something hard like I'm doing.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: There is a prolonged silence. Brigid starts to think her burdenbeast might have be mistaken. She looks around and sees the collapsed houses nearby, as well as the scattered supply packages.
It's been at least twenty-four hours since the Catastrophe. Finding any more survivors at this point is very unlikely.
Okay... no survivor then. Don't worry, big one, everyone makes mistakes.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: (stomps angrily)
attributes.name: Burdenbeast

attributes.content: I know, I know! But I don't hear anything? Do you? Maybe you're smelling something else.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Moo!
attributes.name: Burdenbeast

attributes.content: Wait...
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: (lightly taps a stone brick)
(muffled voice)
...There IS someone down there!
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: I'm here! I'm here! Talk to me. Do you have any light? Are you alone? Or—
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: —daughter—
Brigid crouches down, pressing her ear to the stone, where the sound is clearer. She leans in close, trying hard to hear every syllable.
Help...
attributes.name: Woman's Voice

attributes.content: I need you to speak clearer!
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Help... my daughter...
attributes.name: Woman's Voice

attributes.content: Your daughter? So two of you down there, huh? How's your daughter doing? She there with you?
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: After a series of faint sounds, the woman's voice becomes clearer.
It's dark down here. I can't see much... We're buried. She fainted. I don't know...
attributes.name: Woman's Voice

attributes.content: I beg you, save us—
attributes.name: Woman's Voice

attributes.content: Is your daughter near you?
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Yes, yes... She's here in my arms. We're trapped under the rocks—
attributes.name: Woman's Voice

attributes.content: You're holding her? Take a deep breath, then listen to her closely. See if you can tell if she's breathing, or if she feels warm.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: ...ughh... Yes, yes!
attributes.name: Woman's Voice

attributes.content: Good. From here on out, you have to keep talking to me.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: When people relax all of a sudden, they can quickly lose consciousness, so you need to keep talking to me, slowly.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: About anything. Just.. tell me how old your daughter is, the color of your hair, whatever.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: The nomad nimbly gets up from the ground, removes her bells, raises them, and steps toward a more open area.
Amidst the sound of the bells and wind, she sends a distress signal to her fellow nomads in the wilds.
...My daughter is 3-years-old. I have red hair...
attributes.name: Woman's Voice

attributes.content: What race are you? I'm a Perro.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Feline... My daughter and I are both Felines...
attributes.name: Woman's Voice

attributes.content: What's your name?
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: My name is Evelyn...
attributes.name: Woman's Voice

attributes.content: What's your daughter's name?
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: What's that? I can't hear you.
attributes.name: Woman's Voice

attributes.content: Nomad? Nomad? Are you still there?
attributes.name: Woman's Voice

attributes.content: I'm here. I'm sending out a distress signal for my buddies. You're brave. You've kept her safe. Now we just have to wait for my friends to get here, and you're as good as rescued.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: What? We still have to wait?
attributes.name: Woman's Voice

attributes.content: No... no... there's no time....
attributes.name: Woman's Voice

attributes.content: Don't worry, there's time. You're still with me. Your daughter's still alive, right in your arms. We've confirmed your location, and there are no signs of aftershocks. You're going to be rescued. Trust me!
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: But I—I can't feel my legs. Even if you get me out, I'll be a cripple!
attributes.name: Woman's Voice

attributes.content: Wha—
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: So don't worry about me, or your companions. I beg you, nomad, just save my daughter!
attributes.name: Woman's Voice

attributes.content: I'm begging you!
attributes.name: Woman's Voice

attributes.content: Even without legs, you'd still have your eyes and your arms.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: You'd still able to see and touch. You protected your daughter from the Catastrophe, and now you want to leave her all alone?
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Why?
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: You don't get it, nomad. You don't understand...
attributes.name: Woman's Voice

attributes.content: Maybe I don't. So explain it to me. Remember what I said? Keep talking.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: But slowly. No more yelling like before. You'll just tire yourself out before you know it.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: No...
attributes.name: Woman's Voice

attributes.content: ...Brigid?
Hm?
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Nemos! Did you get my message? That was fast!
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: What message?
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: I taught you how to listen to the wind before, remember?
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Of course you do. How else would you find me here? But that's not important. You're just in time. Over here, quickly.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Our mission is urgent, Wakewoman. We can't afford to waste any time.
attributes.name: Dublinn Soldier

attributes.content: I know, it's okay. This is my friend. She's a Taran nomad.
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: Nemos, who are those soldiers with you...?
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: The Dublinn rescue team. We're here from Na Saoirsí.
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: Oh.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: So it's a rescue mission, right? The people on that wee nomadic city made it out safe, but some of the others didn't. I found two survivors here.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Right here, under this rubble?
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: Yeah, right where I was standing. A mum and her kid. The mum's still conscious and talking, and the daughter's alive, but unconscious.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: So I take it you'll keep searching elsewhere?
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: Yeah. I already sent a message for my companions in the area. It's always faster working together, then we can move on right quick and keep looking for more.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Well, we're here now. You can go continue your search. Dublinn will take it from here.
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: Wakewoman, the mission The Brigadier gave us was to—
attributes.name: Dublinn Soldier

attributes.content: I know, but there are two Taran survivors down there, and last I checked Dublinn was a Taran movement. Am I wrong?
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: We'll take over the rescue mission here. Does that work for you, Brigid?
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: Of course. This isn't the first time we've worked together like this, it's not like you need me with all those extra hands.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Follow me. I'll show you the exact spot.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: ...We can split our forces. Some of you will stay here to handle the rescue, while the rest can come with me.
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: Wakewoman.
attributes.name: Dublinn Soldier

attributes.content: You sound worried. How are the mother and daughter doing?
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: The nomad gave a good summary of the situation before the nomad left, but even with all of us working together, it'd take a while to clear the rubble and give them some breathing room before we can rescue them.
attributes.name: Dublinn Soldier

attributes.content: Our main task is to save the refugees who've been encircled by the Victorians, and we can't put that off for long.
attributes.name: Dublinn Soldier

attributes.content: And we can't afford to split up either, or it'll take even longer.
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: Exactly. Also, the mother insists on speaking with you. She says she wants to talk to the person in charge.
attributes.name: Dublinn Soldier

attributes.content: Then let me speak with her.
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: Hmm... Haven't we already been through here? Isn't this where we discovered the mum and her daughter?
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Looks like Nemos and the others have left, so they must've been freed a while ago. You sure your nose is working, big one? We overfeed you or something?
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Moo, moomoo—
attributes.name: Burdenbeast

attributes.content: (charges forward)
attributes.name: Burdenbeast

attributes.content: *sighs* Where you off to now? I was only kidding, okay? Don't run off!
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: You—
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Uh...
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: The rubble conceals the body buried deep beneath. It isn't until she gets closer that Brigid notices a hint of bright red on the gray surface, covered in dust and dirt.
The hint of red is actually a few locks of hair—a woman's hair.
...Evelyn?
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: (weak breathing)
attributes.name: Evelyn

attributes.content: She's still breathing... Hey, Evelyn! Wake up!
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Evelyn!
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: *Cough* *Cough* Ugh...
attributes.name: Evelyn

attributes.content: You're Evelyn, aren't you? Why'd they leave you behind?
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: ...Where's Nemos and the Dublinn soldiers? They were supposed to rescue you—
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Ma'am...
attributes.name: Evelyn

attributes.content: ...Rescue my daughter... Take her away from here...
attributes.name: Evelyn

attributes.content: I beg you...
attributes.name: Evelyn

attributes.content: Don't give up on her, and don't come back for me... Just take her!
attributes.name: Evelyn

attributes.content: ...What?
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: I already... told you... before.
attributes.name: Evelyn

attributes.content: What did you tell me? I don't know. You'll need to say it again.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: The nomad begins digging through the rubble with her tools. But working alone, her progress is too slow, and the woman's voice grows ever fainter.
These stones... I'm sure I'm... Infected...
attributes.name: Evelyn

attributes.content: Even if I survive... no one... will take me in...
attributes.name: Evelyn

attributes.content: ...And my legs... I can't move them...
attributes.name: Evelyn

attributes.content: I'll just be a burden.
attributes.name: Evelyn

attributes.content: Hrrh...
attributes.name: Evelyn

attributes.content: No, no, no! You're wrong!
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: You've got it all wrong!
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Ma'am, please... Keep your distance, please...
attributes.name: Evelyn

attributes.content: 'I'll rescue you.' 'I can still save you.' What should she tell her?

Any of those would be a lie. Brigid soon discovers that the rubble has already shifted from the previous rescue efforts. The broken bricks caught around the woman's waist are both supporting her and slowly killing her.
....'It's always faster working together.' And the fastest way was—
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: They split open the bricks above your head, removing the connection holding both sides together. All the broken bricks and rubble, all that weight, came tumblin' down right on top of you.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: They did it because they knew you'd protect your child. They knew you'd hold out, at least until she was safely out of your arms.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Right?
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Ironically, rescuing the child had directly led to abandoning the mother. Even had they come back for her, they would not have been able to free her.
But Nemos... How could she have let them do this?
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: I know they could've rescued both, if only they'd spent more time on it.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: (wailing)
attributes.name: Burdenbeast

attributes.content: *cough* *cough cough* Don't waste your energy, ma'am.
attributes.name: Evelyn

attributes.content: ...I—you—
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Need anything else?
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Yes. I heard them call you Wakewoman...
attributes.name: Evelyn

attributes.content: You mean Nemos? I'm not Nemos, or a wakewoman.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: ...I can't tell if you're real or not... but...
attributes.name: Evelyn

attributes.content: Can you wait... until I take my last breath... and...
attributes.name: Evelyn

attributes.content: ...bury me properly... as a wakewoman...?
attributes.name: Evelyn

attributes.content: Ngh... *cough*...
attributes.name: Evelyn

attributes.content: The woman can barely speak. Her chest heaves like torn bellows, rapidly but to no effect.
It is evident that her time is almost up.
*cough*
attributes.name: Evelyn

attributes.content: The woman furrows her brow, and her ashen face suddenly flushes red with pain.
Ugh...
attributes.name: Evelyn

attributes.content: The nomad stops her useless digging. She places her dirty palm on the woman's tense, wrinkled forehead.
...How's this? I've seen Nemos, er, the wakewoman do this before.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: A gentle touch can take away the pain and soothe the sick. Comfort parents who've lost their kids.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: But with the hands of a nomad...?
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: (nudges Brigid with snout)
attributes.name: Burdenbeast

attributes.content: Go cozy on up to her, big one. Maybe a wee bit of warmth will help.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: ...Wakewoman? Ava... did you take Ava with you? My daughter...
attributes.name: Evelyn

attributes.content: She's safe now. You can relax. Don't talk.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Ah—Ahh... thank you. Thank you so much.
attributes.name: Evelyn

attributes.content: *cough* *cough* You're still here. I want to...
attributes.name: Evelyn

attributes.content: What is it?
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: I want to see Na Saoirsí...
attributes.name: Evelyn

attributes.content: Na Saoirsí? Okay, I'll remember that.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Ugh... Argh!
attributes.name: Evelyn

attributes.content: It hurts... it hurts so much...! B—but... my legs are already numb... why——
attributes.name: Evelyn

attributes.content: Agh——*cough* *cough cough*!
attributes.name: Evelyn

attributes.content: Moo!
attributes.name: Burdenbeast

attributes.content: Don't talk anymore.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: ...Grkh...
attributes.name: Evelyn

attributes.content: Go to sleep, Evelyn.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: *cough*...ahh...
attributes.name: Evelyn

attributes.content: The woman takes a final, heavy breath. Her torso, which is sticking up from the ground, goes limp. Brigid suddenly realizes the woman's body must have been crushed in half by the stones some time ago.
Moo!
attributes.name: Burdenbeast

attributes.content: (nudges Brigid hard with snout)
attributes.name: Burdenbeast

attributes.content: I know, buddy. We need to get her out of there. Can't let her end up in a tuskbeast's belly.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Come here. Lend me a hand, err... paw.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Let's take her to see Na Saoirsí.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: The Dark Woods allow the nomad passage. One nomad and one burdenbeast, carrying the departed to the edge of the forest.
Further along, at the end of the road, stands the bright city of Na Saoirsí, built of bricks and stones.
*Huff*...
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Sorry, Evelyn, I couldn't make a big enough bonfire. I can't return the fire to you like the wakemen do, like you wanted.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Also, I don't think you were infected? The Infected usually explode after death, but even after waiting for nightfall, nothing happened to you.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: But even if were, you shouldn't have died like that.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: On the way here, I thought about taking you to the ruins, to see the real wakemen, but you said you wanted to see Na Saoirsí.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: So after giving it some thought, I took you here.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: (soft wailing)
attributes.name: Burdenbeast

attributes.content: Look on the bright side? Maybe...
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Maybe Ava's already back in Na Saoirsí with Nemos by now. And if I bury you here, you won't get in anyone's way, but you can still see them from here. Maybe even... hear them.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: (brings some wildflowers and places them in front of the grave)
attributes.name: Burdenbeast

attributes.content: Thanks buddy, but could you get me some flowers like these—
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Ah, forget, I'll get 'em myself. You stay here with Evelyn.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Brigid leaves the Dark Woods and ventures out into the open plains.
Here, the sound of the wind will no longer be disrupted by the rustling leaves. She will be able to clearly convey her words to her friend.
Wayward wakewoman, if you can still hear me...
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.text: The pledge you once made with your heart's flame, is it still in effect?
If it is, then why do you abandon those who can be saved?
If not, then why do you make such empty promises?
I am full of anger and doubt. I hope you'll come see me.
So that, under cover of darkness, with the Dark Woods as my witness,
I will see whether you still walk alongside me, from a thousand miles away.

attributes.content: ...And now to pick a few flowers.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: She should be here by the time I get these flowers and weeds twisted into knots. Just like before, she'll climb over the ruined stone walls and cross the cape where the lighthouse went dark... to see me.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: She'll be here before sunrise.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: There are two small bundles of nondescript flowers, one wrapped in leaves and placed in front of Evelyn's tiny grave, the other tied into a knot and placed at the nomad's feet.
She waits until dawn, just to dispel her lingering doubts. However, by the time the sun rises, all the questions she wanted to ask have lost their meaning.
She can wait no longer.
(gently nudges Brigid with snout)
attributes.name: Burdenbeast

attributes.content: She didn't come.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: (gentle rub)
attributes.name: Burdenbeast

attributes.content: Do you think she's always made this choice, every time, and I just never knew?
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: She was always a wee different from the other wakemen. But ever since she left the ruins and the wilds, and went to the cities on the wheels...
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: She hasn't been the same.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Moo, moomoo—
attributes.name: Burdenbeast

attributes.content: I know, big one. It's past sunrise. She's not coming.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Okay, let's go! We've waited long enough.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Brigid stands up with the help of the burdenbeast. She leaves the knot where it is. Her limbs are a bit stiff, both from sitting too long and the bitter cold.
She takes one last glance at the burial mound in front of her, ignoring the sun-drenched nomadic city behind her.
Goodbye, Evelyn.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Quite a long while after the nomad leaves, another pair of hands picks up the withered, yellow knot on the ground.
Brigid?
attributes.name: Nemos
